unnormalised: Yeah, LaTeX can be a bit of a pain initially, but once you get the hang of it, it's super useful. I was struggling with writing equations like `x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}` for my engineering assignments. My prof suggested using an online editor which really helped. Now, I can easily type up complicated stuff like `\int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}` without much hassle. Took me about 2 weeks of consistent use to feel comfortable, so hang in there!
normalised: Yeah, L-A-T-E-X can be a bit of a pain initially, but once you get the hang of it, it is super useful. I was struggling with writing equations like x equals the fraction with numerator negative b plus or minus the square root of b squared minus four a c and denominator two a for my engineering assignments. My prof suggested using an online editor which really helped. Now, I can easily type up complicated stuff like the integral from zero to infinity of e to the power of negative x squared d x equals the fraction with numerator the square root of pi and denominator two without much hassle. Took me about two weeks of consistent use to feel comfortable, so hang in there!
